description.displayText:
Trista is amazing and any family that she works with is lucky to get her!!  We have had Trista as our nanny in a nanny share for going on 2 years.  Both children LOVE her and miss her when she is away.  
She is extremely dependable and has an outstanding work ethic.  
She has been in our home with our child/family from the age of 1.5 until 3.5 years and has planned curriculum based on her age and growing needs.  She has taught and worked with her with numbers / letters / communication / manners / etc.  
We entrust Trista to drive our child to field trips and they weekly go to the Zoo / Swimming / etc. 
During our time with Trista we have faced emergency situations in which she was key in communicating and ensuring our child received the aid needed in a timely manner. 
We are sad to move on from our nanny share with Trista and are moving on to start preschool prior to Kindergarten.  I would recommend Trista for any form of childcare.

description.displayText: Trista is absolutely AMAZING. She cared for my four young children (ages at start date: 6 months, 3 years, 5 years and 7 years) for a year and a half. She has a wonderful ability to keep the children engaged, excited, entertained while still maintaining behavioral expectations. She developed a daily schedule with them and really helped with homeschooling during the COVID-19 outbreak. My home was always in order when I came home from work and she maintained great communication with me throughout the day so I knew how the children were doing and ready for my evening with them. She truly was a gift to our family and we miss her dearly. We are sad she relocated but happy for her. Georgia families are lucky she moved to your state! I would rehire her in a second.

description.displayText: We wanted Trista to be our full-time nanny, but in the end we decided on a different childcare arrangement for our 5yo and 2yo.  We reached back out to her to babysit for us last night while we attended a work function.  She was *amazing.*  Not only did we come home to both kids in bed by 8:15 (a wonder-- I wish we could do the same), but the kitchen area and family room had been tidied up!  I am so impressed by her sweet nature, dependability, and just overall personality.  I will definitely try to get on her schedule again before she gets completely booked up with other families!

description.displayText: Trista has been our full time nanny for our two boys and niece for the last six months.  We have been thrilled with Trista since day one!  She is so sweet with the kids, and they adore her.  She is incredibly flexible and has adapted to our changing needs on an almost weekly basis.  Trista takes pride in her role, and is constantly coming up with fun experiments and crafts to do with our preschool-age kids.  She's been a great help around the house, and is always asking for projects to do while the kids are napping.  It was a sad day when Trista told us she was moving back East.  She will be impossible to replace!

description.displayText: Trista was an impressive candidate beginning with our first communication. Her resume, nanny and personal references, and overall professionalism set a high bar for the remainder of our Nanny search. Our more part-time family needs simply didn't meet with her (well-deserved and certainly fair) full-time pay expectations so we chose a different candidate. We are keeping her name at the top of our list should our needs change and we need someone more full-time.

description.displayText: Our family dynamic has changed, and unfortunately it impacts Trista. I would recommend Trista, as she is great with my children, dependable, and trustworthy. She manages a great schedule with the kids as well as the house. She always completes tasks, and graciously asks if there is more that can be done on her end. Her pleasant demeanor is always a great way to be greeted at the end of the day.
